verb.description: To counsel against (an action, undertaking, etc.); = "disadvise".

origin: Late 15th century (in an earlier sense). From Middle French desconseiller, desconseillier, desconsillier, French déconseiller to counsel (a person) against some undertaking or course of action, to counsel against (an action, undertaking, etc.), with remodelling of the prefix after dis-.
